titlestmt.titleproper: Presidential Coin and Antique auction catalog photographs, circa 1989-1995
titlestmt.author: David Hill

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by David Hill using EADitor ©2011

change.item: Imported into EADitor. Some normalization has occurred to apply EAD 2002 schema validation and conform to EADitor basic requirements.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Presidential Coin and Antique auction catalog photographs
did.abstract: Photographs and page layouts used for the production of Presidential Coin and Antique auction catalogs.

daodesc.p: Part of a photograph from the collection of a 1901 Philadelphia election campaign ribbon

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: H. Joseph Levine opened Presidential Coin and Antique of Clifton, Virginia, in 1971 and operated it as a retail walk-in store for thirty-four years until its closing in 2005. The company continues to do business by mail, internet, and auction and specializes in U.S. political collectibles, including tokens and medals.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Presidential Coin and Antique auction catalog photographs, circa 1989-1995, Archives, American Numismatic Society.

userestrict.head: Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright restrictions may apply. Permission to publish or reproduce must be secured from the American Numismatic Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Photographs, mostly prints but including some negatives and slides, and page layouts used for the production of Presidential Coin and Antique auction catalogs from about 1989 to 1995. Includes photographs of tokens, medals, badges, ribbons, and other collectables, mostly from the United States, in the following and other categories: presidential and political, inaugural, police, transportation, nineteenth century merchant, world’s fairs and expositions, Civil War storecard, U.S. Mint, peace, life saving, agricultural, foreign, Hard Times, Bryan Money, and So-Called Dollars.
